LGTM. Merged to trunk and 0.10.2.

@mjsax Could you file a follow-up JIRA for letting KafkaStreams to maintain a single `StreamsKafkaClient` that is used for both internal topic management and backward compatibility, or any future added admin functionalities?
Merged to trunk and 0.10.2.
Done: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/KAFKA-4706

@kkonstantine @hachikuji Could you review? These are 2 of the last 3 built-in SMTs we have from KIP-66. I'd like to get these in since we've seen asks for both on the mailing lists (directly, for casting when the connector can't constrain the range of values, and indirectly for Flatten for use with connectors that can only handle flat schemas).

The final SMT missing is TimestampConverter, which I think is really useful, but probably too complex (both implementation + testing) to squeeze in. However, these two are useful enough that I think we should push them through if possible.
Rebased to resolve conflict.

Thanks @guozhangwang. I've updated the new JIRA with the the per-operator num.replica info. I've also re-opened the queryOnRebalance JIRA.
Updated the code to use double rather than integer in the `hasMoreAvailableCapacityThan` - also added checks for capacity <= 0

Thanks for the reviews, I merged this. Someone from Streams can submit a follow-up if additional changes are required. Thinking about it, it would be a good idea to mention that Streams only supports brokers with version 0.10.1 and above (unlike other clients).

@ewencp, do you think it's OK to include this in 0.10.2? It technically adds a command-line parameters to some tools, but that parameter already exists in a number of tools, it's just making them consistent.

actually @mjsax, `GlobalKTable` might just work. It uses the same `KTableSource` so that behaviour is consistent. Also the KStream-GlobalKTable joins re-use the: `KStreamKTableJoinProcessor` so that behaviour should be consistent also
retest this please

I thought I had mentioned this, but maybe I didn't publish it: it would be good to briefly mention in the KafkaConsumer and KafkaProducer class javadoc about compatibility and add `@throws UnsupportedVersionException` to the various public methods.
